commitResults.messageTitle: git commit
Added functionality to echo commands entered by users
Add ability to store text entered by user and display back to user when requested
Add the ability to mark tasks as done and unmark tasks as undone
Added the Task Class
Add the ability to mark tasks as done and unmark tasks as undone.
Added the Todo Class
Added the Deadline Class
Added the Event Class
Minor edits to toString method
Added ID to each Task for tracking
Added support for tracking three types of tasks: Todo, Deadline and Events
Added SomException Class to handle exceptions.
Added methods to deal with errors such as incorrect inputs entered by the user.
Added automated UI testing
Added support for deleting tasks from the list.
Add Javadocs for all classes
Add encode() method to Task and subclasses for file saving
commitResults.messageBody:
Each Task has its own parameters and formatting.

Let's,
* make the Task class abstract with an abstract encode() method
* add the implementation of encode() within each subclass of Task

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage class and implement auto-save/load in Som
commitResults.messageBody:
The app currently loses all tasks when it exits because it does not save data to disk.

Lets implement file-based persistence using a Storage class to automatically save and
load tasks. Tasks are saved in a structured text format and reloaded on startup with
the data file stored at ./data/som.txt.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Teach the chatbot to understand and format dates and times
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot currently treats date/time inputs as plain strings, limiting
its ability to parse, compare, or format deadlines and events
meaningfully.

Let's store deadline and event times using java.time.LocalDateTime
and support date parsing and formatted display.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement date/time parsing and display using LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Teach the chatbot to understand and format dates and times in tasks.

Parse date-time input in dd-MM-yyyy format for deadlines and events,
store using java.time.LocalDateTime, and display in user-friendly format
 (e.g., Dec 02 2019 6:00PM). Add support for date-based task filtering
with the 'find' command.

Let's do it by using LocalDateTime for accurate date-time
representation, DateTimeFormatter for parsing and formatting, and
consistent integration across Task subclasses.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
Refactor Som into modular classes for better objected-oriented design
commitResults.messageBody:
The code is currently structured in a way where most logic concentrated
in the Som class, making it harder to maintain and extend.

Let's extract Som into four key classes:
* Ui: handles all user interactions
* Storage: manages loading and saving tasks
* TaskList: encapsulates the tasks List and related operations
* Parser: parses user commands and creates tasks

This is done to improve code organization, readability and
maintainability through applying key OOP concepts. Classes now have
more specific responsibilities, making it easier to test and maintain.

No functionality is changed. All features work as before.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Command classes for extensible OOP design
commitResults.messageBody:
The ChatBot logic was previously handled with if-else statements in the
main loop.

Let's replace the statements with Command classes. Each command is now
a class inheriting from an abstract Command parent class.

This is done to make the code more modular and aligned with OOP
principles. New commands can be added without modifying existing
logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-MoreOOP'
Organize classes into subpackages som.task and som.command
commitResults.messageBody:
As the number of classes increase, a single package becomes clustered
and hard to navigate.

Let's divide classes into logical subpackages:
* som.task: Task-related classes
* som.command: All command classes

This is done to improve code organization, and each package has a
clear responsibility.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-Packages'
Merge branch 'add-gradle-support' into master
Integrate Gradle using add-gradle-support branch
Add comprehensive JUnit tests for Parser, Deadline and TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser, Deadline and Tasklist classes are currently not tested
automatically, which makes it difficult to detect bugs introduced
during future changes.

Let's use JUnit 5 with Gradle to test supported commands and their
valid and invalid cases.

The tests use standard JUnit assertions and are integrated with Gradle
for automated execution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add automated testing to verify the correctness of the TaskList class
Add method to support automated testing
Add support to build and generate .jar files
Edit find command to search for tasks by keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the find command was used to look for Deadlines and Events with certain dates.

Let's implement 'find <keyword>' to list tasks containing the keyword by:
* Edit findTasks to search for description instead of dates
* Update Parser and Ui classes
* Add to help

Users can now search their task list using keywords.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test case for "findTask" JUnit test
Add JavaDoc to core classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
JavaDoc was incomplete for multiple classes and methods and might be hard for others to understand the implementation.

Let's:
* Add header comments to most classes and methods
* Follow JavaDoc conventions: @param, @return, @throws, @author

Adding JavaDoc improves code readability and maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update JavaDoc to follow Java Coding Standards
Apply coding standards for consistency
Merge branch 'branch-A-JavaDoc'
Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-9'
